com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream

Class DataSourceStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer.upstream.DataSourceStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loader.Loadable, NonBlockingInputStream

    public final class DataSourceStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements Loader.Loadable, NonBlockingInputStream
    Loads data from a DataSource into an in-memory Allocation. The loaded data can be consumed by treating the instance as a non-blocking NonBlockingInputStream.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DataSourceStream.DataSourceStreamLoadException
      Thrown when an error is encountered trying to load data into a DataSourceStream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataSourceStream

        public DataSourceStream(DataSource dataSource,
                DataSpec dataSpec,
                Allocator allocator)
        Parameters:
        dataSource - The source from which the data should be loaded.
        dataSpec - Defines the data to be loaded. dataSpec.length must not exceed Integer.MAX_VALUE. If dataSpec.length == C.LENGTH_UNBOUNDED then the length resolved by dataSource.open(dataSpec) must not exceed Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        allocator - Used to obtain an Allocation for holding the data.

      • isLoadFinished

        public boolean isLoadFinished()
        Whether the stream has finished loading.
        Returns:
        True if the stream has finished loading. False otherwise.

      • getLoadedData

        public final byte[] getLoadedData()
        Returns a byte array containing the loaded data. If the data is partially loaded, this method returns the portion of the data that has been loaded so far. If nothing has been loaded, null is returned. This method does not use or update the current read position.

        Note: The read methods provide a more efficient way of consuming the loaded data. Use this method only when a freshly allocated byte[] containing all of the loaded data is required.

        Returns:
        The loaded data, or null.

      • getAvailableByteCount

        public long getAvailableByteCount()
        Description copied from interface: NonBlockingInputStream
        Returns the number of bytes currently available for reading or skipping. Calls to the read() and skip() methods are guaranteed to be satisfied in full if they request less than or equal to the value returned.
        Specified by:
        getAvailableByteCount in interface NonBlockingInputStream
        Returns:
        The number of bytes currently available.
